meanings.definition: A person or thing that depresses or lowers.
meanings.sent1: The constant complainer at work is a real depressors.
meanings.sent2: The rainy weather can be a depressors on our mood.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy cat became the depressors of the party.
meanings.sent4: The negative news acted as a depressors on the stock market.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds were like depressors hanging over the city.

meanings.definition: A muscle that draws down a part of the body.
meanings.sent1: The frowning muscles are the depressors in this facial expression.
meanings.sent2: The calf muscles act as depressors when you point your toes down.
meanings.sent3: The tired leg muscles decided to be the depressors and make walking difficult.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the bag felt like depressors pulling on my shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The gravity seemed like invisible depressors pulling us towards the ground.

meanings.definition: A drug that lowers physiological activity.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed depressors to calm the patient's nerves.
meanings.sent2: Some depressors can help reduce anxiety and promote relaxation.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy bear mistakenly ate the hibernation depressors and dozed off early.
meanings.sent4: The herbal tea acted as a natural depressors, aiding in sleep.
meanings.sent5: The soothing music worked like magical depressors, easing tension in the room.
